thread.title: A 300kg powerlifting goal that proved fatal for 17-year-old prodigy in Bikaner
thread.title_full: A 300kg powerlifting goal that proved fatal for 17-year-old prodigy in Bikaner

author: Nitesh Kumar
title: A 300kg powerlifting goal that proved fatal for 17-year-old prodigy in Bikaner
text:
A 300kg powerlifting goal that proved fatal for 17-year-old prodigy in Bikaner
Jaipur: Powerlifting champion Yashtika Acharya who died in a freak gym accident this week had one goal â€” to lift 300kg. The 17-year-old from Bikaner aimed for this milestone to help her bag another gold at the upcoming national championship in Jammu and Kashmir. Her drive to achieve the target was so intense it kept her in the gym for hours, pushing her to the limits at an age when most of her peers were still mulling over career choices.
Her promising sporting career ended too soon, however, when the 270kg barbell slipped and crushed her neck during training Tuesday night.
Ganesh Acharya, owner of the Bikaner gym where the incident occurred, said Yashtika had unwavering focus. "She wanted to reach the 300kg mark. In Oct 2024, she won gold at the National Equipped Bench Press Championship in Goa, lifting 250kg. The second runner-up in the junior category lifted about 200kg. This time, she was determined to break her own record in the tournament she planned to participate in next month," Acharya told TOI Thursday.
Yashtika's dedication and determination often meant sacrificing things most teenagers like her would cherish. She skipped a family wedding in Hanumangarh, unwilling to miss even a few days of training.
